name: Natrum phosphoricum
Relationship: Compare: NATRUM LACTIC. (rheumatism and gout; gouty concretions; rheumatism with diabetes); NATRUM NITROSUM (angina pectoris. Cyanosis, fainting, copious liquid stools at night; throbbing and fullness; faintness, nervous pain in head, nausea, eructations, blue lips). NATRUM SILICOFLUORICUM - SALUFER - (a cancer remedy; tumors, bone affection, caries, lupus, ethmoiditis. Must be used carefully); NAT-SELEN. (chronic laryngitis and laryngeal phthisis; hoarseness of singers, expectorate small lumps of mucus with frequent clearing of throat); NAT-SULPHUROSUM (diarrhoea, with YEASTY STOOLS); NAT-SULPH-CARBOL. (pyaemia; purulent pleurisy, 3 to 5 grains every three hours); NAT-TELLURICUM (breath has odor of garlic; night-sweats of phthisis) CALC.; ROBIN.; PHOS. In oxaluria 1x four times daily prevents formation of calculi; keeps the oxal. of lime in solution (Schwartz).

Eyes: Discharge of GOLDEN-YELLOW, CREAMY MATTER from the eyes
Stomach: SOUR ERUCTATIONS, SOUR VOMITING, GREENISH DIARRHOEA
Head: Feels dull in the morning, full feeling and throbbing
Mind: Imagines, on waking at night, that pieces of furniture are persons; that he hears footsteps in next room
Back: Weariness; aching in wrists and finger-joints
Face: Paleness of bluish, florid appearance of face
Mouth: Canker sores of lip and cheeks
BLISTERS ON TIP OF TONGUE, with stinging in evening
THIN, MOIST COATING ON THE TONGUE
YELLOW, CREAMY COATING AT THE BACK PART OF THE ROOF OF THE MOUTH
Thick, creamy membrane over tonsils and soft palate
Nose: Naso-pharyngeal catarrh, with thick, yellow, offensive mucus
Female: Menses too early; pale, thin, watery
Sterility, with acid secretions from vagina
Leucorrhoea; discharge creamy or honey-colored, or acid and watery
Skin: Itching in various parts, ESPECIALLY OF ANKLES
Feet icy cold in daytime, burn at night
Male: Emissions without dreams, with WEAKNESS IN BACK AND TREMBLING IN LIMBS
Ears: One ear hot, frequently itchy, accompanied by gastric derangements and acidity

details: Natrum phosphoricum is the remedy for conditions arising from excess of lactic acid, often resulting from too much sugar. Ailments, with EXCESS OF ACIDITY. Sour eructations and taste. Sour vomiting. YELLOW, CREAMY COATING AT THE BACK OF THE ROOF OF MOUTH AND TONGUE. Inflammation of any part of the throat, with sensation of a lump in throat. Flatulence, with sour risings. Colic, with symptoms of worms. of joints. JAUNDICE (1x trit.) Oxaluria.
dosage: Third to twelfth trituration. In Jaundice 1x. Non-homeopathically. Phosphate soda used hypodermically for Morphine habit, by Dr. M. J. Lys. Phosphate Soda, 75 gr. daily, for constitutional iodism, thyroidism and Grave's disease.
